I've started grad school. The thing of it all is that I had all of these expectations and fears but, in the long of it I haven't really seen what it is I thought I would. However, there was this strange realization, the same one I had when I started college that eventually petered out; the things we give into college is what we get out of it. 

The pursuit of knowledge and the pursuit of how we know that knowledge has always been something that has driven me. Right now, having finished a bachelors by the skin of my teeth, I am confused. That confusion is leading to a variety of radical personality shifts and some gains in responsibility. It's strange. I find myself actually being the age I am. I think it's the first time in a long time that this has actually come to pass. I think the last time was what, when I was 10?

In any case, the lofty aspirations of my publication wants and dreams need to be grounded. For better or for worse, I am stuck where I am for 3 years at the least. So, with that in mind, I am trying to work up to a working definition and understanding of a few things; namely that of play, games, and leisure.

Johan Huizinga is probably the basis of all thought in the idea of play. There are other definitions and works, but from those i've spoken with, it's a good start. I'm concerned with a bunch of definitions; but namely I am thinking of 3 words, Play, Fun, and Game.
 
The first word i'm thinking of is play. Huizinga defines it as "a voluntary activity or occupation executed within certain fixed limits of time and place, according to rules freely accepted but absolutely binding, having its aim in itself and accompanied by a feeling of tension, joy, and the consciousness that it is different from ordinary life."

From there, we'll start building more.

Racist Tendencies and Stereotypes in MMORPG's: Final Fantasy 11 This study is the result of two years of participant observation in the society of Final Fantasy 11 (FFXI), a fantasy genre based perpetual virtual world consisting of over 500,000 participants from around the world. Between 2004 and 2006, the author joined FFXI's players in each possible level of participation with other players and between groups of players. The formation of racially identified groups in this virtual world and the competition between them is the focus of this study. Through stereotypes and racially motivated behaviors such as name calling, accusations, and violence, these groups compete over in-game resources. From "Nips," to "Sand Niggers," "RMTs" to "Botters," the terminology of this behavior often mimics those terms found offline. Competition over resources and lack of control over additional video game content allow the author to demonstrate the parallels of real world power structures that develop within Massively Multiplayer Game's separate from game design. So, here we go. I've finished one version of this paper and i'm going to have the second version of it complete by the end of this week. Next week I will finish my presentation and i will practice and hone it until it is old hat. I am scared shitless. I suppose the natural flow of this paper goes something like this. Intro Lit Review Methodology Findings Conclusions Each section will be anywhere from 3-5 pages. The lit review is going to be rather extensive as when I wrote my initial paper it brought about a variety of emails and instant messages with book suggestions. As of right now, I am in possession of: Race in Cyberspace" Beth E. Kolko, Lisa Nakamura, and Gilbert B. Rodman Technicolor: Race Technology, and Everyday Life Alondra Nelson Thuy Linh N. Tu Alicia Headlam Hines Half Real: Video Games between Real Rules and Fictional Worlds Synthetic Worlds: The Business and Culture of Online Games by Edward Castronova What Video Games Have to Teach Us About Learning and Literacy James Paul Gee and countless papers and thesis from around the country/world Also, I have my notes from my playtime, Screenshots from the time in game ala Joe, and a ton of old threads in text form, as well as old livejournal entries and misc screenshots from other forums. With all this in hand I am somewhat overwhelmed. I will be presenting this stuff and i'll be presenting after a case study of drug use in online gaming culture. My basic idea is that there was a dominant group, the japanese. Time passed and they had no new content to compete for so they began to fade from dominant status. The North American, white dominated group came in and ascended to the old Japanese level followed by a large amount of new content to compete for. The dominant group was accustomed to the norms of the game + the norms of their culture. As time passed, some of the dominant group found that they were different from each other. Kuwaiti groups began a slow separation from the main group. This group, with it's large amount of resources and non-american norms were sort of driven into a corner by the dominant group and forced to be subordinate. The resulting reaction was aggressive and within a year, the Kuwaiti group had achieved the status that their former North American friends had had for years. The subordination and resulting feud generated thousands of forum posts not only Bismarck but in a variety of servers and other online habitations as well. The thing I am most worried about is that while I never actually said that I was there as a scientist, I often asked about why certain things were the way they were and the idea to write the paper came much later; at the end of my career in game. Ethical concerns and anonymity are always in question. While it is almost impossible to find out who the gamer is on the other side of the screen, it does give a point with which to begin tracking people down. An avatar name followed by a forum name will give an IP whereupon that can be traced and a real name attached. Those that are here will know who I am talking about when I refer to Tat or Blue Steal so I will be forced to remove the server name and rename each shell and person in order to deal with possible ethical issues. Also, the fact that while each group knew my interests, none have consented to be studied, further reenforcing a need to create anonymity. I have to wonder what sort of criticisms I'll receive. I also have to wonder if i'll be able to stand around for 20 min or 30 min and jabber about Fafnir and how much 1 zone in the game created so much animosity. Sadly, I may have to create a glossary for this paper. Race Bot Kuwaiti PC NPC Fafnir Nidhogg King Behemoth NA JP Gil-Seller Call for Help MPK Glitch Kill-Steal DOT and more. Sigh. I sense more cards in my future.

So, I played Portal this weekend. I have to say that I was sort of impressed by a game that seemed to be thrown together haphazardly but was intended to be sort of tongue in cheek awesome. Most of the puzzles I just sort of wandered through but Forrest and Mike got to yelling at me for finishing puzzles so I just ended up doing what they said. I like playing games that end up with me not really being more than a guy on a controller taking directions. It reminds me of Mario Party. I also saw Mike perform and that was good. God knows all of my failed attempts to see Mike perform lately were, at best, enormously frustrating. Additionally, this weekend was the end of a friendship; well, at least it probably is. Me being friends with girls is proving to be too stressful and/or filled with useless emotions. Sometimes people don't really deserve an unfiltered me. I also played Mario Galaxy; that game was pretty and super fun. I'm glad to see that Nintendo can still make an old franchise have tons and tons of new ways to be. I think the best quote was, "So in this game Mario is a Spaceship?" He sure is. I'm wrapping up this semester and i'm going to be goddamn poor this week. Without Maggie there to feed me it's not going to be the most fun of things. I have enough food to eat but, do I have enough caffeine? I just don't know. I hate this inability to feed my addictions. I am going to be so busy this week that i'll probably break down midweek. I have to write a speech as well. The only directions of the speech are, "Be Profound." I have an awesome idea that starts with the line, "Ten years ago this August, I stood in Bluffton, Ohio talking to the girl I was going to marry; the girl I had known my entire life. I looked at her, my ring on her finger, and I said, 'Brett, I know that there's more to the world than this and I have to go to college to understand why I know this.' I left Ohio, single, a year later." I want to talk about things like how hard college can be. The realigning of perceptions and goals and dreams; the idealization that slowly congeals into a disdain and mistrust of the institutions of Sociology. I think that'll be pretty profound. Then, this break, I have to seriously work on a new paper for my racism in ffxi thing; and I have to work up some more stuff on the things the professors wanted me to do. Ugh. Without money this won't be fun! But, I'll actually have more money than I thought. i'm super super glad. With that, I must go now.
What is a Meme? A meme is: An idea that, like a gene, can replicate and evolve. A unit of cultural information that represents a basic idea that can be transferred from one individual to another, and subjected to mutation, crossover and adaptation. A cultural unit (an idea or value or pattern of behavior) that is passed from one generation to another by nongenetic means (as by imitation); "memes are the cultural counterpart of genes".

So, So, So, I've had a pretty awesome week all around. Work, Life, Games, everything is going really well! I worry about the inevitable road block but it isn't going to come from me this time. I'm going to need to get a part time job I think, to fill the gaps between the end of the semester and New Years. I could probably work a hell of a lot somewhere. I guess i'll see about temp work or something. So, let's talk about Final Fantasy 11. So, when I quit the game I sold my equips, money, character, and game discs. I didn't want to go back because I was using it as a crutch to get through an awful time in my life. Such is the way of the virtual world I suppose; what if it does represent a more entertaining alternative than real life? Ok, so, being that I always felt bad for abandoning Damon, Forrest, Nile and even Joe, I took an offer from Forrest to go back to playing FFXI with a friend of their's character. He was TaruTaru, and the same model as me, just different color hair. It's strange being another person's character but it's been awesome now that I moved to a server with Forrest and Nile where my old character isn't known. The other thing that is strange is that my experience and knowledge of the game is far greater than my character's stats and abilities or equipment. I'll have to do a lot of quests and things over again to get myself back to where I was. Being that it had almost been 3 or 4 years since I had played the job Objection had leveled, I was exceedingly worried about not being good at the job. I knew how it would work but I was worried my attention to detail had diminished and my skill had decreased. But, I had a plan! I would begin by camping a lot of mobs on my own, then I would install an expansion and start working my way up to the spot where all of the people at the highest level did things. So, Wednesday was the day that all of that happened. I installed and went about refamiliarizing myself with an almost completely unfamiliar part of the game. I have to say that it's exciting getting back into the game now that there is so much more of the game to play. I had grown bored with the other aspects of it. It's strange; very strange, to have to reacclimate myself to a world I was so familiar with. Stranger still, and the reason for this entry, is the extreme differences I see between servers. On Bismarck, I grew up with the rest of the North American players on a server that had been dominated by the Japanese. By the time we were in our upper 60's, the Japanese legends had sort of started disappearing. I remember one of the first high level clothcrafters in the game, Kid. I first saw this god amongst players as a level 30 guy. I remember checking him and he immediately change gear so I couldn't look at his gear. His bazaar comment always said, 'DO NOT CHECK ME, EVER'. But, such things do not last. After a time, all of us had surpassed our japanese competitors and we began to take over the camps. All new content we finished before them; all new monsters we went and killed. We took over everything for a good long time. And then, that too began to diminish. We had become those legendary characters. And we too, began to disappear. On Asura There are almost 0 Japanese players. i know they're there, i've made friends with some of them and i've made a point to remember what shells they're in and what they do. it's fun tracking people to see what time they devote to what. I think i've always enjoyed that part of the game; stalking through the search function. On this server, it seems as though all of the old shells that came around the time IRON, ArchDominus, and the Lunarians did, also are disappearing. I remember LordWafik's shell, but that's about it. It seems like the legendary shells on Asura were either too ubiquitous to really notice or they were so mediocre as to never really be noticed. I have to say that of the shells i've seen, I would like to see them fight fafnir. I've been thinking of heading down there just to watch. I wonder how many times i'd get checked!? The strangest thing about Asura is the acronym PST. I had never seen it before but it seems like Japanese and English use it alot. Please Send Tell (PST) is used instead of the Bismarck Traditional /tell (Name). The other thing too is the amazing amount of completely english search comments. Instead of @2k (WORLD): O (GEAR) (GEAR) (SUB) (SUB) it's 'I'm at 2k and I ususally sub this job. I don't have thse things. Invite!) The server seems dominated by young players too impatient to create a successful and meaningful shell. And the shouts, dear god. Most of the players on Bismarck I knew would help each other out. Instead of standing and shouting for hours on end about wanting to do a quest, you'd go through Flists to see what people needed done and if they could help. I suppose that still exists to a degree on Asura but watching the chat log grow ever longer with shouts in the space of a few seconds is aggravating. I think it's almost time to shut off my ability to watch them. The Game in General Back when i was playing, certain jobs and the people that leveled those jobs were a joke. Dark Knight, Dragoons, and unless you were completely rolling in money, Samurai. Most shells would use 1 or 2 Samurai and Dark Knights to go after things. Armies of Summoners were the norm. but, then Square decided to beef up 2-handed weapons and these guys who were a joke with bad gear, bad attitudes, and little talent, suddenly have a means with which to be good and through no fault of their own. Just doing experience points in the new areas, i've seen so many Dragoons and Dark Knights who die getting to camp do insane damage just because they happen to have a 2-handed weapon. It's a shame to see focused and amazing parties replaced with half-assed 'good because the makers decided to make something in the game amazing' parties. I used to be able to do xp parties on my own without needing any type of refresh. Haste and Regen were always enough. But now you have these DRK/DRG or DRG/SAM or some combination of the 3 that don't and won't sub sam that take so much damage i've been forced to expend some untold amount of healing before the second monster we fight even dies. But, it's still fun. I like the Aht Uhrgan stuff i've seen. Ghost Pirates and Salvage seems to be really fun. I guess we'll sit back and see what happens with everything. Oh leon, you poor soul:

This song gets me through the day. Ok, this song too. I'm ashamed I like Muse but this song is so good. This is probably the most obtuse entry i've ever made. This time of my life is meant to be one of experimentation and revelation. But, going in, I had already been through all that junk. I've seen and done things that I wouldn't ever wish other people to experience. Living in this town, I feel so old that it's depressing at times. At times. But then I get past it and I soldier on to the goals i've set for myself. I've faltered several times on my way here. It's really hard because of the amount of alone i've made myself. It was somewhat stupid of me. I shied away from people for a long time. From what i've seen, i'm supposed to come out of this part of my life with a future wife and tons of friends. But in the long run i've got friends I don't get to see as often as I like and the women I have an interest in are so completely unreachable that at times I feel as though I may as well give up. Again, at times. But, I am far more than willing to fight for these things. Thanks to all this not killing me and making me stronger bullshit i've put up with, I can take far more emotional strife than anyone ever should. Speaking of, my ego took an incredible amount of damage this weekend. I can't think of a more destructive weekend that I didn't construct for myself. I usually do pretty good on the self destruction, you could almost say it's a hobby. So, what does one do to rebuild confidence? The only thing I can think of is what I always do, suck it up and dissolve the damage that was done through force of will. The ego is very malleable. As long as you have the will to tell it to do things, you can make it into whatever you want. But i'm sitting here with this gargantuan feeling of despair and emotion I don't really know what to do with. I'm so unpracticed in these matters I don't always know what to do. Do I act on this? Do I buy 4 tubs of Ice Cream to bathe in? Do I buy a knife and go around town Shanking tires at will? What? What? I guess i'll just brush this off too and resolve to not let myself be so vulnerable. Vulnerability is something i've never been able to hide. I am easily destroyed. I am easily hurt. I've never tried to hide it. I think maybe that my confidence might mask this somewhat. I doubt people ever realize when i'm about to lose my temper or go through some magnitude of emotional outbreak. A woman once told me that i'm more girl than she is. But, that's not it at all. She loved misjudging me. Just because I know what my emotions are does not make me any weaker than a man who can only show confidence, anger, and happiness. I can be that guy too. I'm sorry if I find the way I was raised to stereotypical to follow. In a sense, i've never tried to belong to any sort of stereotype. I like conversation and if I know what things feel like, if i experience things, then my conversation, ability to hold conversation, grows. I doubt anyone will give a damn about anything I wrote up here. I was asked why I write everything publicly pretty recently and I wasn't able to really give her an answer. I've been thinking about it and I pretty much just decided that I fall into the anonymous confession category. I like saying things about how and why I feel. If people see it and want to comment, cool. If not, that's cool too. There's something about hiding things that has always bugged me. If we all just knew each other a little better, what would that do? Too often you see people completely introverted because they feel some deep dark secret will betray some aspect of their past. Who cares! If people can't handle people doing things, regardless of content, they shouldn't be part of society anyway. We all make mistakes, what makes mine worse than yours? So there you have it. I personal post about personal feelings about personal matters no one understands. Excitement.

My week has been sort of on the bizarre side. I guess the best way to put it is what I downloaded this week: Garth Brooks - complete discography - oh yeah Yeah Yeah Yeahs Fiona Apple Gravity Kills Jet Set Radio Dragonforce and Mindless Self Indulgence I feel all over the place. At times it's the best of times, others, worse than i've ever been. Now, I pretend to lead an uncomplicated life but, when reality shines on the LaLone vessel, my life is far more complex and insane than I could ever communicate. It's a weird happenstance; most accuse me of doing it on purpose. I just want a simple life; but I will take complicated steps to ensure the life I want. Anyway, maddness. Politics I have to write a research paper in Japanese this semester. I wasn't sure what I was going to do it on until i remembered hearing about Japan calling their military a military now, not a defense force. Japan, apparently, has the 4th largest military spending budget in the world. Their armies are technologically superior to a lot of armies in the world and with the lowering population of the homeland, I'd say Japan has a real reason to want to expand. Still, I don't think anyone really can stop them at this point. They've grown beyond the UN or the US requiring them to ask if they can deploy troops. I don't know if anyone even noticed when this was first done back in 2004 when Japan, illegally (according to the US written constitution (article 9), sent troops to Iraq to help America without permission from their own government or the UN. In compromise the troops weren't armed, but the symbolic standoff between the public of Japan and the government brought about the steps required for Japan to deploy their military where they like, when they like. Needless to say, Korea and China are scared. It's a strange time in the world. With all of the world powers routinely moving about their armies for whatever reason or another, made up or not, it seems a lot like the time just before World War 1. Is a world war always the answer to a build up of troops? Have we out grown our planet so much? It's a strange time to be alive. I can only hope I reach 35 before a draft happens...though, with the recent testing of the draft machinery maybe it'll come sooner than that. I don't know how i'd fare against whoever i'm shooting at. It's sort of disheartening to think about. I feel like a hippy.

I feel like this sometimes. I've been trying to ride my bike more. I haven't drank soda in weeks. I haven't opened up or played anything but a case of Phoenix Wright in almost a month. What happened? Where did the time go? When did life become so hectic? It's a strange thing when I find myself actually doing things. It doesn't happen to often but when it does it usually goes on for years. Regret, apprehension, and doubt continue to show up in my life. But, somewhere along the line I discovered I could tell them to go away. And they do! It's strange. I wonder when I picked my confidence up from Carla. She had it for a really long time. I've been eating better, running pretty regularly, and losing weight. It's been a good couple months. My hair needs a trim, but I did what I never could before, and just let it grow and do what it wanted. All in all, the one place i've been slacking in lately is the school department. I'm so close to being done but i'm dragging. Senioritis was never something to slow me down before. But, I try to get my homework done, and too much tempts me away from it all. I say temptation when really it's my choice to begin with. But, with such possibility, who wouldn't? So, here I sit, in the library at 530 on super bowl sunday wanting to do my Japanese homework and accomplishing little more than writing a ramble about my shamble of a life. Wait, is it a shamble? Actually, no it isn't. I used to think it was. I used to let someone do a lot of thinking for me; it didn't work out and now she won't talk to me without screaming. She hates it when I think for myself. At work, I was told today that I don't give off the impression that it's possible for me to have a one night stand. I don't know what to think about that. This combined with another thing someone told me, 'You feel feelings feelingly,' sort of hints that this might be true. I wonder if there is something I can do about that. I wonder if there is something I should do about that. I just don't know.

So Tristram Shandy. I watched the mocumentary that came out recently. Right now i'm bidding on two old versions of this book. I'm actually amassing furniture and possessions again; to the point where I'll actually need a truck to move. It's been such a long time that I felt substantially alive that I couldn't really tell what it was when I first felt it. I think this post came mostly out of boredom than muse.

I went and saw Children of Men tonight. I wasn't really sure what to make of it when I was going in aside from thinking, 'What if Women couldn't get pregnant anymore?' We had had a discussion about the birth rates of the world going down. It's a pretty simple disaster that could happen without anyone ever realizing it. It's a fine balance that we keep. Although we've been going slowly upward for so long, there may come a time when the balance slips. Then what do we do? The population will shrink. If it shrinks just 1%, the economies of the world would probably go through a depression the likes of which no one had ever seen. Less people spending money but more work than could ever be done. Empty houses, empty schools. It's weird to think about logically. This is an excerpt from an article from the American Association of Geographers: Many scientists believe that economic development is a major factor causing birth and death rates to fluctuate. They argue that with development, people gain better access to birth control; public health and sanitation improves; women become more independent; and food and basic necessities become more plentiful. These improvements, in turn, increase life expectancy and eventually prompt women to have fewer children. What evidence is there to support the theory that economic development leads to a decline in death and birth rates? Some demographers point to the population histories of Western European countries as examples where populations that once grew rapidly experienced a graduate decline and stabilization of birth and death rates as a result of improved food supplies, public health, and technology. Historically, population changes in Western Europe corresponded to the following four stages, which are modeled on Figure 2: Stage 1: Both birth and death rates are high and population grows slowly, if at all (Europe between pre-history and about 1650). Stage 2: Birth rates remain high, but death rates fall sharply as a result of improved nutrition, medicine, health care, and sanitation. Population grows rapidly (Europe between 1650 and about World War I). Stage 3: Birth rates begin to drop rapidly, death rates continue to drop, but more slowly now. Economic and social gains, combined with lower infant mortality, reduce the desire for large families (Europe between 1920 and 1960s). Stage 4: Both birth and death rates are in balance, but at a much lower rate. Population growth is minimal if at all (Europe in the present).
Population Growth Rate - Worldwide
Economic Growth has been going up constantly and pretty consistently since what, 1987? Just what would happen if there were less people next generation than there are now? What if all those purple nations fell significantly under 0? The amount of people spending money or making money to tax would shrink. What would happen then? Or maybe, probably, definitely, I don't know what i'm talking about and i'll need to read a couple books and do a paper on it to really understand. It's really the only way I learn anymore. Sometimes I think that the perpetual why that is in my head and drives me constantly looking for something deeper does little more than stop any sort of forward progress in thought capabilities. So there, if a movie makes me think about that much retarded shit, it must be good! Right? Well, in any case, i'm very happy about the way this movie turned out. I was getting bored of sci-fi movies trying to be trendy with quirky characters in designer clothing and recycled ideas instead of critical ideas about societies future. I started in on FF12. Everytime I start a game like this I wonder where the patience I had as a 11-18 year old went. Aside from FFXI, i've not been able to get through a new RPG since Final Fantasy 9, that was what, almost 7 years ago? But I keep trying. I think the longest game i've managed to get through that was made in the past 5 years is Metal Gear Solid 3 and that was only because it just might be the best game ever made. FF12 does have Balthier though, "The Leading Man." I can't think of a man whose played this game and hasn't had a mancrush on the dashing skypirate. He keeps me going in much the same way that Bond keeps you going. The females in the game are nice. The idea of an everlasting bunny girl is perverse in the way only Japan can muster. Compared to the rest of the leading men in action movies i've seen lately, only Matthew McConaughey in Sahara really portrayed the hero in an awesome way. Yeah, Yeah, Yeah, Sahara wasn't that good of a movie. But, formula movies follow predictable patterns and that is always fun. Who doesn't like an Indiana Jones movie with a twist? In any case, it's a bit overwhelming, Final Fantasy 12, but it's worth it. If you like grand adventures full of political intrigue, romance, and gigantic floating fortresses named after mythical creatures, FF12 is just for you.

What does a scanner see? Into the head? Down into the heart? Does it see into me? Into us? Clearly or darkly? I hope it sees clearly because I can't any longer see into myself. I see only murk. I hope for everyone's sake the scanners do better, because if the scanner sees only darkly the way I do, then I'm cursed and cursed again. A Scanner Darkly I bought this movie after not being able to rent it for almost a week. Going into it I knew two things, ok 3, I like Keaneu Reeves and I love Phillip K. Dick. I also knew that I had spent years dodging the movie Waking Life and that now would be a good time to go into the hippie infested pretentiously reflective Linklater dimension. From beginning to end, I was amazed. It wasn't just the way the movie was drawn, it was the atmosphere, the message, and the clever way they managed to get the Dick perception across. I've watched nearly every Phillip K. Dick adaptation that's been made. I'm obsessed with Dick. Hell, I own most every adaptation as well, but this movie captured the thing I love most about him. It doesn't matter if you've ever read a Dick story or not, this movie is worth watching if for nothing else than a small glimpse into a mind that understood where we were going, and didn't like it one bit. New Year's Eve/Day. Last New Year's, and I walked clear across town to go to the new castle of Brandon Zuern, my oldest friend. It had been a long time since I had really hung out there; I was excited that I actually got to do something outside of El Rio. So, ok, i'm going to whine. Whine I went to work today; it was actually pretty nice. During my lunch break, I went to the pawn store nearby and bought the movie As Good As It Gets. Now, I don't really like Jack Nicholson. Say what you will about that statement, but this is about him in this movie. In this movie, he's about as real as a person can get. He's flawed, weird, creepy, fucked up, and every other adjective you can think of to describe a normal human male. But, every once in a while, you get this glimpse of what he can be. He can be a good person; he can be a gentleman. But what's the point? He's got money, success, and the big kicker is that he enjoys his work and he's good at it. But why should he be a gentleman to a world that could give a fuck less about him; a world that can only care for the work he does? I think that this is where I am right now. I've been feeling this for a while. It's not that i'm a jerk (though I can be) and it's not that i'm weird, crazy, a megalomaniacal, ego tripping, cheauvanist piece of man meat looking for a hole to stick things in. All I want is to know that I can become a better person. But from where do I find the motivation? Where do I turn to see improvement? For years, I had thought that relying only on myself was the way to go. But this sort of thing leads to introverted tendencies and is somewhat contrary to what many believe is the human way; that we are social creatures. So, this, inevitably leads to relying on others for meaning that is, in it's own way, a central tenant of the Mead school of thought in sociology: Symbolic Interactionism. But in practice we are only connected to those we know. If we spend all our time putting up a front for those we know, can we truly improve ourselves? Or is the irony in all of this the simple fact that becoming a better person means simply fitting in with our friends better? Yes, i'm leaving psychology and biology out of this. Those people that subscribe to those schools of thought far more deeply than I can tell me about social psychology and chemical imbalances; however, this isn't about that. What this IS about is a simple question: Is the only motivation to become a decent person simply the reward or ability to not be noticed unfavorably? I suppose that this finally turns toward philosophy. The conversation was about a favorite topic of mine lately-nintendo. This article, called Age of Disruption is a not-so-critical review of Nintendo's ploy to state they are not competing with Sony and 360. What they are trying to do is disrupt or change the market that exists now and are attempting to replace it with their own model. From this perspective we can see sort of what they've supposedly been doing for the past few years. I suppose that one side of this arguement could be that Nintendo has been messing with the market for years. With the revenue Pokemon and GBA sales generates, Nintendo has never needed to worry about money or poor Console sales. Because of this, they could simply send out the intentional viral form of what Nintendo felt should be the next few steps in the game market. Is it possible that they could've forseen that the endall of the current market model would be the PS3 and the 360? Did nintendo's research department really figure out that, starting with the N64 and moving through the Gamecube, they could insert the virus (wii) they designed into the market almost 10 years ago? I mean, Nintendo has been trying to reach younger and older gamers alike with Games like Diddy Kong racing, the Mario Party series, the Mario franchise has always been geared toward audiences that aren't really there to play video games. Pokemon has kept kids interst for almost what, 15 years? Some voice said that Nintendo is not as good a company as everyone makes them out to be. Everyone overestimates Nintendo. When you look at their track record, you could say that this is true. However, Nintendo does have one hell of a staff designing projects for their first party games. They've just always lacked in the 3rd party area. Gamecube had some fun games, it even had better ports than some PS2 games (Resident Evil 4, the resident evil series in general), and it's always been the source of party games (ok, they're a bit kiddy but they're sinister at the same time, like Japan). If Nintendo's plan has been the Wii all along, if N64, Gcube, the DS, SP, GBa were all parts of a much larger attempt to disrupt, destroy, the current video game marketing model (like people will buy Sony and Microsoft's new model anyway - 30 dollars for a car I can drive in game?!), then I think that it might be that people have underestimated Nintendo's ability to control the market they helped create in the first place. Vin Diesel, yes, that Vin Diesel. I suppose most people wrote this movie off. I bought it randomly, while walking through a video store that was going out of business. I will admit I am entertained by Vin Diesel a lot. I think it was around XxX and my ex, Carla, that all this began. I wouldn't call it a mancrush so much as amused respect. This will be a short review. I don't want to talk more about the movie than I should as I know what it's like to have movies spoiled for you (OH MY GOD HE WAS DEAD THE WHOLE FUCKING TIME). I know that Diesel can act. Boiler Room was a pretty ok change from the action star I think maybe everyone expected him to become. For a while, I was ok with him just being the new action dude but I started reading some of his interviews, in particular this interview, and thought that maybe he was just a guy who was trying to break into Hollywood by being some buff action guy all the while trying to find ways to do what he actually wanted; to act in normal movies. Like the IMDB page says, Find me Guilty is based on a real-life event; Federal Agents seize not just part, but all of a crime family and put them all on trial. Diesel's character is already on jail for getting caught in a drug sting. After his lawyer gets him 30 years in jail for the drugs, he fires the lawyer and decides to represent himself in a court case that still calls itself the longest trial of all time (almost 2 years). Diesel's performance is something I don't think many people will be expecting considering half of the waking world who knows about him probably consider him to be some brain dead action star. If you're looking for a movie that will make you laugh, make you think about the American Justice System, and maybe make you see an actor in a different way than Hollywood intended, Find Me Guilty is for you. Speaking of action heroes, action movies wouldn't be where they are now without Arnold. Walking around the HEB by my workplace, bored on break one night, I stumbled upon Arnold Schwarzenegger Celebrity Pack which includes Predator, True Lies, and Commando. For 15 buck you get these three outstanding movies (say what you want about True Lies, it's awesome). By the way, what's up with the doof in chainmail in Commando? I forgot about him. I suppose there are two things here that I feel need to be said. One is that Lamb is a book that pretty much approaches the same idea that The Davinci Code does. Today when I woke up I started thinking about art; also, what is art? Specifically, digital art. To me, art is what happens when a new idea appears through a medium like television or whatever, and the mainstream, or public, likes it so much that other artists can abuse it to an insane degree. In other words, some thing that perfectly defines a general subject that is then copied ad nauseum until the next big thing comes along (stupid drip paint on canvas Pollock, J.R.R Tolkein). You can usually see what's going to happen if you look around at the stuff that's happening just off the mainsteam area. It's usually a different take on an old thing, or maybe, just maybe, it's something new. I'm not saying that all the stuff that happens between periods isn't art; i'm just saying that to me, real art is the stuff that defines a new direction, a new idea, of what that medium is or can do. Everything in between are simply steps to the next big idea; necessary but not really breathtaking or inpiring in their own way, just a feeling of, 'ok, we're getting there.' This is not to say that art is some all encompassing thing, one genre, variety of media; but that each media is, in a sense, defined by the current idea of what that media is used for. Any media could be used for any sort of genre, that's fine, but the way it is used never changes. TV and movies are for showing moving pictures; ideas through visalization, books are for expressing ideas with words; sometimes with the aid of pictures, and pictures are used for a variety of reasons, Sculpture, well, I don't know enough about sculpture to really say anything more than it seems as though they are 3d representations of pictures, copies of our reality, or representations of abstract thought. So, is the digital a media, or a new way for old things to be used? Well, to me, the digital is a way to combine everything into one media. Words, pictures, moving pictures, sculpture, music, everything. It's sort of new. No one seems to understand or comprehend the full potential of this idea. I sit here, at night, in this studio apartment trying to understand the visuals I have in my head. What do they mean? What is it i'm seeing? I can't put it to words. The funny part is that this isn't just about art, art will happen regardless of what happens now, but the way art is distributed and percieved is up for grabs. For instance: (page 1)But Regardless of whites' "sincere fictions," racial considerations shade almost everything in America. They also recieve an inferior education compared to whites, even when they attend integrated institutions. In terms of housing, black-owned units comparable to white-owned ones are valued at 35% less. Blacks and Latinos also have less access to the entire housing market because whites, through a variety of exclusionary practices by white realtors and homeowners, have beensuccessful in effectively limiting their entrance into many neighborhoods. Blacks recieve impolite treatment in stores, in returants, and in a host of other commerical transations. In short, blacks and most minorities are, "At the bottom of the well." The most important factor in this book is his central idea: ...new racial ideology that I label color-blind racism. I really like what this book has to say as it sort of gives voice to a lot of the things i've always wondered about as I grew up in a completely white town. I suppose I do such things, or did such things, when I found enough sex to keep me violently happy. That was a mistake. More than anything that's happened this summer, i'm glad I managed to work up the courage to talk to Les again. I suppose he's more of a father figure to me, or was, than my father ever was. But really, it was the teacher in him that allowed me to grow.
